hook.text: A developer adds a caching layer nobody asked for, 'just in case.' It breaks in production.

buildup.text: YAGNI says don't build features until they're actually needed. Predicted needs are usually wrong.

discovery.text: Unneeded code still has to be maintained, tested, and understood by everyone who touches it.

twist.text: Engineers fear being unprepared. But unused abstractions cost more than building them later.

climax.text: Build what you need today. Refactor when requirements change. Most predicted needs never arrive.

punchline.text: The best code is the code you didn't write.
